intro: Lepisorus namegatae, commonly known as the Japanese rock fern, is a species of fern native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, dense growth habit. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates in shaded, humid environments. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a leathery texture. Lepisorus namegatae is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soil.
